title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION MECHANISMS

description.narrative: Ministries in charge of social protection and municipal authorities have increased capacity to support social protection mechanisms based on solidarity and social safety nets adaptive to shocks in targeted areas., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most marginalized children, adolescents and young people benefit from evidence-based social and economic policies and social protection programmes that address multidimensional poverty and advance the equitable realization of their rights.

Supporting the adaptation and/or scale up of social protection systems to be gender-responsive or transformative

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Ministries in charge of social protection and municipal authorities have increased capacity to support social protectionmechanisms based on solidarity and social safety nets adaptive to shocks in targeted areas.

description.narrative: En 2021, le système national de transfert monétaire (Cellule Filets Sociaux et son bras opérationnel, Projet Filets Sociaux Adaptatifs PSFA) a mis à l’échelle le programme de transfert monétaire d’urgence COVID-19 (transfert unique de 45 000 CFA) pour près de 405,000 ménages, dont 32,649 ménages avec l’appui financier de l’UNICEF . Pour la première fois, plus de 120,000 ménages vivant en milieu urbain ont été ciblés. Les données du Cadre Harmonisé de Novembre 2021 annoncent une crise alimentaire sévère en 2022, laquelle testera la capacité du système de protection sociale à anticiper et protéger les populations affectées par les chocs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
